definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

pinyin: Ji1 li3 ba1 si1 Gong4 he2 guo2

sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯的自然資源非常稀少。

sentences.english: Kiribati population of about 100,000, scattered in 33 coral islands.
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯人口約10萬人，散佈於33個珊瑚礁島。

sentences.english: Post-secondary education and training are available both in Kiribati and overseas.
sentences.chinese: 基里巴斯國內外都提供中學以上的教育和培訓。
